description:
This is a family owned Japanese restaurant in the sunset with friendly service and delicious food.

I've been here twice already, and I continue to wonder how I lucked out in living so close to an awesome sushi restaurant with fresh sashimi!! Honestly, I wouldn't order anything from the menu other than the sushi combos, which are both extremely reasonably priced and also super fresh. If you ever dine in, you will see that most tables only order sushi, nigiri, sashimi, or hand rolls.

The first time I came with my dad, I overestimated my appetite and ordered a donburi and a sushi combo. Needless to say, my stomach was bursting from the food after finishing the combo and barely half of the donburi...The donburi was also not anything special. The next time I came, I simply ordered the special combo which is a decent assortment of sashimi and one order of tuna rolls. It was plenty of food for me...and all for only $10. Pretty amazing, considering that omakases in the city can run anywhere between $70-120 easily!! 

I know I will be back again and again!
author: Sherry L.

description:
We came at 8:30 on a Saturday night and there were 2 parties in front of us and the 10 or so tables were all full. I almost left at that point because I was starving but I asked the hostess and she said the wait would be less than 10 min and sure enough it was! 

The ambiance is cute and cozy, the wall art felt unique and authentic (I normally don't even notice this kind of thing but these Japanese traditional murals were pretty awesome), and the prices were fantastic. We were served quickly and the sashimi was great quality and delicious. The rolls were also tasty though not as standout as the sashimi. Free miso soup and salad came with our meal. The overall bill was about half of what you'd pay in SOMA for this amount of sushi. Great experience and I feel as if I've found a new gem! Definitely plan to return!
author: J L.

description:
Small place with a wait time. The system is to write your name on this board by the entrance. There is no notification via text or app so you will have to wait around the area. We ended up sharing our table with another party, which was awkward since we were on the inside of a bench with only one way to get out. 

Anyways, if you happen to dine here, I recommend sticking to the cooked options or at least dishes with some type of sauce since the sushi was pretty much bad in terms of the way the fish was sliced, taste of both fish + rice, and freshness of fish and probably the reasons why it was so cheap. Even the cooked dishes such as beef sukiyaki and beef amiyaki were just so so although better than sushi.
author: Sophie C.

description: I've become significantly less enamored with this place in recent months. My original review still stands, but the agedashi tofu was just NOT GOOD. It had a gelatinous mochi-like covering (perhaps tapioca flour that was not deep fried enough?) and super weird. I had to take off the battered part to eat the underlying plain tofu, which was quite firm and stood up to my barbaric finger-ripping. Just weird.
author: May L.

description: Me and my 1.5 year old had a delicious bento box for early dinner. We enjoyed a quick and friendly service. This cozy place is rather small, and very authentic as confirmed by happy faces of the Japanese customers. We will definitely be back.
author: Julia A.

description:
Someone mentioned food orders were coming in staggered and I was like ?????. But now I understand lol.

The sushi here cost less than most in the area. Definitely a place to get your quick fix of sushi or lunch.  

Food is okay and seating is very limited. Parking is a pain as well.
author: Dorian C.

description: Had the 16pcs sashimi combo. It was a good value and ok on the freshness. Age Dashi Tofu was different this time. I'll just say today was not what I expected.
author: Alex R.

description:
Perfect place for an inexpensive Japanese meal. There is always a wait here so I suggest calling ahead of time to reserve a spot. I called 10-15 ahead of time and was seated right away upon arrival. 

Everything that was ordered was really tasty. Not so sure about the raw fish though.. I highly suggest ordering the cooked items only. 

Items ordered were: 
1)Gyoza: It would taste better if it was pan fried to a little crunch
2)Spider Roll: Comes with soft shell crab! Very good! 
3)Dragon Roll: Yum! 
4)Spicy scallop Roll: Yummy! 
5)Sunset Roll: Roll includes salmon which is topped with Tuna and yellowtail. Wouldn't order this again. Not the best quality raw fish. 
6)Beef Amiyaki: Beef is very tender and juicy. Also comes with a salad. Highly recommended. 

Look forward to trying other items on the menu.
author: Bonnie T.

description:
My go-to Japanese restaurant in San Francisco... everything is delicious and the price is so good. 

I always have so much trouble ordering here because I want to eat sushi rolls but their bento box options are such a good value that I have to get that instead. Their rolls are small but lower priced so you can actually order more and get a better variety for the same price as other sushi restaurants too. My go-to items are the Spicy Scallop, Rock and Roll, Special Combo Bento (Or just make your own Bento).

This place is small and gets quite busy and in my experience it's really random whether you can get seated quickly or will have to wait. I definitely feel the seating comes in large "waves".
author: Daniel C.

description:
Came here right around 5pm opening time. Was pretty hungry so I ordered the katsu donburi AND a pink salmon roll. My mistake, could not finish them both and had to take the roll back home.

First, the salad and miso soup came out. Salad was good, but a bit too much dressing. Miso soup was okay, I think because I let it sit there too long and it cooled off. 

The pink salmon roll came next. It was good, but nothing amazing. I was hoping this roll tasted like a Lion King roll that I like to get at other places. 

Lastly, the katsudon came out in a flat bowl/plate thing, kind of hard to eat from, wished it was in a normal round bowl. But anyway, it wasn't bad. There was lots of egg and onions, with some mushrooms and fish cake. I thought the katsu was a little bit dry. I would've liked it more maybe if the egg was more runny and not fully cooked. Also, it'd be nice if the katsu wasn't completely covered so that there would be some crispy pieces.
author: Wesley S.

description:
My roommate was craving sushi, so we stopped by Fujiyama since it was nearby to us. This place is located along the lovely street of Noriega..right next to Home Cafe if you're looking for a coffee place nearby ;D The restaurant is small and cozy. It can get busy, so going off hours might be a good option if you don't want to wait. 

Fujiyama has very affordable prices for a wide array of Japanese food ranging from sushi to donburi bowls, bento boxes, and other Japanese dishes. I ended up ordering nigiri with a California roll, and was pretty disappointed. The fish for the nigiri was cut very poorly and thinly. The rice was not made well either and seemed a bit stale. But I suppose since the price is so affordable, you get what you pay for. The California roll was okay, but again, the rice was made poorly. 

The service was okay. I can see that when it gets busy, service might be a bit slower as there aren't many servers for the number of tables there are in the restaurant. If you're looking for a fast, affordable bite, this is your place. But if you want good sushi, please go elsewhere.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I will preface this by saying the food was 4 stars. Solid sushi at a good price, with lots of options to choose from. I ordered the chirashi and enjoyed it. However, the service here was terrible. Our food showed up staggered, with the first and last dishes appearing 40 minutes apart from eachother. Since we were a party of 4, the timing was awkward and the waitstaff didn't acknowledge that service was slow at any point. Aside from the slow service, it wasn't an especially warm experience. We had a hard time flagging waitresses down to get tea, or even to place our order. 

The food was good, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend this spot to my friends. Might be good for takeout? Otherwise, you can probably do better.
author: Lauren C.

description:
The sushi is great for the price. This is right down the road from where I live and we frequent often. The place is small and can get busy, but there are some small bars nearby while you wait. The Chirashi Combo is a great deal and is extremely filling (and healthy!).

I do not recommend anything other than the actual sushi. The biggest con of this place is the honey mustard dressing on the side salads (would love if it could be ginger!!).
author: James S.

description: This place is near by, and i check it recently and i would say im pretty impressed! Im a big fan of sushi rolls and at this place i was pleased with it! They make it super fast and accurate and tasty! The waitress and servers are super fast! And kind! Another good feature that prices are very friendly! I would say it is the best place for sushi rolls i found in SF and im glad that it is close by! Thanks for reading! Im giving 5 stars!!!
author: Stan P.

description:
This place stays crackin. Something has to be said for business like that. Even though it was packed we were seated rather quickly. 

Verdict: Inexpensive, fast eats... but not the highest quality fish. 

We were greeted with hot miso soup. Our rolls, nigiri, tempura, and salad were all good. Portions were on point.

Service was sweet but they weren't really listening to us. Tough to order and to get the check. Sushi came out quicker then the bill. 

Pro Tip: You can order nigiri by the piece!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Big fan of this place. It has never failed me. Don't come here expecting adventurous Japanese cuisine like uni shooters, but do come for the warm environment and the solid food. The restaurant is basically good, solid food at good, solid prices. My go to is always one of the combos (sukiyaki + salmon sashimi). It comes with miso soup, a huge container of rice, and a salad (that is surprising good). 
The staff tries their best when it is really busy, which I appreciate and understand. They can forget things like refilling your water, but they're never annoyed if you remind them 2-3 times. 
Tip: You can call in the day of to make a reservation, and they'll write your name on the white board.
author: Kim W.

description: A bit of a "hole-in-the-wall" popular Japanese restaurant. Menu has the typical options consisting of sushi and bentos. Food was good and satisfying.
author: David H.

description:
Will never come here again. Food was terrible. There's a reason why I've lived in SF my whole life and it took 26 years to try this place. I ordered shrimp tempura donburi. The shrimp tempura was horrid. It was over cooked and so hard it tasted like cheap chicken nuggets. Batter was so thick. The inside of one of my shrimps had mushy black/green goo which I'm assuming was shrimp feces. I paid $10 just to eat rice and didn't touch my tempura after 2 bites. Sushi on the other hand made my husband feel sick and itchy and numb and he's never had this reaction to sushi in his life.

Tables were sticky and service was OK.
author: Sosse M.

description: Beef donburi isn't a real Japan style one...i believe that this is a Chines style restaurant. Donburi should come with egg, not carrot, melon and mushroom...
author: Zoe C.

description: This is a very average sushi place. Underwhelmed by the California roll. Very inexpensive and close to where we were but nothing I would recommend. Actually like how they brought me a can of Diet Coke because it seemed dirty, our table was sticky.
author: Callie D.

description:
Ohhhhh I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet. The most authentic and most affordable Japanese restaurant in the Bay. I and my boyfriend are regulars here, usually 2 Sundays a month. They are busy every time we come here, but we usually only wait about 15 minutes max.  (Thanks to Esther for good service and always being efficient.) I don't know what's their secret but everything we tried here are all good. I cannot think of anything that didn't not taste up to par. 

My Recommendations:
Beef Amiyaki
Real crab California 
Soft shell crab
Chicken udon and 
Chef's Salad

Trust me, you will not be disappointed if you try our recommendations. Happy eating
author: Gwen M.

description:
A little sloppy here. Been here twice but my review is based on my last visit. 

1. Customer service- bad. The staff does not look friendly. We had to waive someone down twice to order. It honestly took forever. The girl placed the miso soup on the table so aggressively that it splattered everywhere. Didn't even bring extra napkins. My friend asked for extra sauce for his food, he never got it. 

2. Food- Good and cheap. Don't expect high quality food. It's good enough for the price though.

What did we order? 
Combo A Beef and Chicken Teriyaki
Combo L Unagi and Salmon Teriyaki
Spider Roll
Beef Amiyaki 
Sashimi (I forgot the spefic dinner but 6 piece salmon and 6 piece tuna)

All are good choices, but I would say Combo L is most worth your money. All the dinners come with miso soup, salad and rice. 

Fujiyama usually has a wait because it is a small restaurant. Parking can be hard at times because of location, but if you are lucky there is meter parking in front.
author: Darlene T.

description: Love this place, its always a good go to for sushi for a cheap price.  We live in the sunset district and we always to here when we have a craving.  Its a little dirty, and dust is seen and soy sauce stains on the walls but hey, what restaurant in San Fran is clean? Its still good for the price. The owner is sweet also.
author: Daniel G.

description:
This place is quite small so be prepared for a wait during the dinner hour. Once you step inside, there is a dry erase board on the side of the wall where you can put down your name for the waiting list. 

Service wise, it can be a bit slow since there are only about two waitresses shuttling back and forth from the kitchen to the cash register to all the tables in a small space. 

Price wise, you get a great deal for the price you pay. I got the Combo F entree which was the sukiyaki with sashimi on the side. If you don't state what you want for sashimi, the default is the maguro tuna. I asked for salmon sashimi instead. The combo also comes with a side salad, miso soup, and rice. All that for $11.95? SOLD! 

Sukiyaki was good. Sashimi was a bit small but this is a good place for those on the budget and want the most bang for your buck. Many of the items on the menu are reasonably priced and you can choose from a wide selection of sashimi, sushi rolls, or bento boxes. Definitely would consider coming back to try the other things on the menu.
author: Diana C.

description:
Wait: 20min (there's a white board you can write your name down on the wall by the door)

Beef Teriyaki House Special Combo: 3.5 (mixed tempura and gyoza were pretty yummy, sashimi was ok, teriyaki beef was bland. I wish they had grilled it or cooked it differently) 

Dynamite Roll: 3 (the menu says it's supposed to come with tuna and yellowtail but it didn't look or taste like yellowtail was included. When I asked if it was in there, the waitress said that it was mixed in with the tuna. My bf and I both agreed that yellowtail seemed like it was missing)

Dragon Roll: 3.5 (since I was disappointed with the Dynamite Roll, I ordered this Roll. It was pretty good but nothing memorable)

Service: 3.5 (Servers are nice but it takes them a little while to get back to you...there were only two working and it was pretty busy so that was probably why)

Overall: 3.5
author: Danica V.

description:
Came here on sunday evening couple days ago and it was my first time coming. This place gets very busy especially that there was only two workers who deal with the customers. It gets full quick since theres always people coming in to eat in and this place isnt big too. 

Anyways, i got the beef udon and crunchy roll. The food was average. I like how the udon came out hot  that i was sweating a little bit while eating it. Prices are the typical price for sushi and the meal/udon/meat where its $8, $10, $12, or higher depending on what kind of sushi and food you get. 

Friendly staffs but service was alright but i understand that the place was busy for a sunday night
author: Julie N.

description:
Good restaurant for an affordable Japanese meal!

I love the chicken katsu salad ($7)! The chicken katsu is fried perfectly... Probably some of the best i've tasted. And the dressing is a honey mustard concoction that has the perfect amount of sweet and tart! It comes with a huge bed of lettuce, bacon, and other veggies.

My bf and I also split the sashimi plate ($16) which had 16 slices of fish: salmon, tuna, hamachi, and escolar/white tuna. All were delicious and fresh-tasting to me.

Something I tried recently was the beef amiyaki (finally!!!). This is one of the most popular items here, with good reason! The beef is cooked nicely and is covered with a sweet teriyaki glaze. A must order if you're a carnivore!

The whole menu is pretty cheap, most things seem to be under $10! Definitely a good place to fufill a sushi craving without breaking the bank.
author: Tara A.

description:
One of my go to Japanese places because the food is decent and cheap. And they always come out with your meals super quick. I definitely come here for the entrees, not the sushi. One of my favorites is the sukiyaki and tempura combo. Big portions, and I normally can't finish the entire meal. I love their tempura, and they give you plenty of huge pieces ! On my past visit, they included fish tempura which I wasn't a big fan of. I also tried the Fujiyama roll ($10.95) and the rock and roll (3.95). Me and my bf found the Fujiyama roll to be quite disappointing, as the shrimp tempura was very stale and the overall roll just left an 'eh' impression on us. However, we did like the basic rock and roll, and super cheap at 3.95 for 6 pieces. Definitely recommend the entrees, and pass on the sushi. 
Try to make reservations during peak hours, as the place is quite small so the wait can be long at times.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Everything here is delicious! The owners remember all the customers that come here. 

Place is always clean that's a plus. My favorite thing here is the tea. Omg I love the tea here. Food is great, the rolls are extremely good too.
author: Margarita V.

description:
I really love this restraint!!
When i brought my Japanese friends, this restraunt makes real domestic Japanese food.
And price is cheap but quality is very awsome
author: Jasmine L.

description:
I came here on a Sunday night around 8 with two of my friends. We waited around 20-30 minutes before being seated. There was only one waitress that was out at a time. Maybe two max. So service was pretty slow, and we had to ask multiple times for drinks and refills. The food came out one item at a time. 

I got the spider roll, Alaska roll, and real crab California roll. For less than $4-5 each, we were shocked at how heap everything was. But when they came out, we saw the size and everything made sense. The sushi didn't taste too bad, though I wouldn't call it great. 

I had to order more food just because the three rolls didn't fill me up. So I ordered the lemon chicken, which is two fried cutlets with a lemon dipping sauce. The cutlets were pretty thin and a little dry. They also didn't have that much flavor. The sauce was actually pretty sweet. It tasted more like an orange sauce. I had to pour soy sauce in the lemon sauce to make it a little saltier. 

Overall, my experience was ok. The waitstaff was friendly, but probably a little overwhelmed. 

If you're on a budget, come here for the rolls because they're very decently priced for the portion received. If you're coming for great food, most along.
author: Jake P.

description: I want to give zero. But that's only because I don't want my place taken over. HOWEVER these ladies are Bs and know how to handle their business. Delicious food, great service, they know who you are and it's fresh. Plus, they are not trying to hide anything. They know they are good but not in a "pushy, I'm cool way". More like, "you hungry I got you" way. Mad respect. Get it girls!!!
author: Carlee M.

description: On Friday night, I called to make a reservation and they took it for 7pm.  We arrived promptly at 7pm and they refused to talk to my husband. I went in the restaurant to get their attention, and they scoffed at me and said "we don't take reservations". I let them know that I'd spoken to someone on the phone and she said "fine, I'll check" in a quite exasperated tone.  10 min later, she hadn't checked and no one would chat with us (or even make eye contact).  We left feeling pretty awful and went to a delicious restaurant down the street!
author: Christina B.

description:
My go-to sushi restaurant in SF. I have been coming here since 2012 and every time I visit I leave satisfied. Friendly, family run restaurant. My boyfriend and I usually order the beef amayaki when we visit. Restaurant is typically busy but the wait is never too long and worth the wait. 

5 stars for the complimentary miso soup. House is salad dressing is yum! Fast & friendly service
author: Mae M.

description:
Beware service is incredibly slow. Food is average. I knew not to order the sashimi and just went with the rolls. This place is hit or miss when it comes to the fish being fresh.... 
We also ordered the combo mix tempera and beef teriyaki. The beef was extremely thin overcooked pieces of dry beef and the tempura did not show up until I informed our waitress it was missing. The tempura was fried well in a light batter. 
Edamame here was boiled for too long they were just too soft.
I'd return cause I live in the area but would not go out of my way to wait in this line or bother w trying to find parking here.
author: Liz N.

description:
I've literally been coming to this restaurant since I had to sit in a high chair. I love the ambience of the restaurant, they play classical music (which I've come to love). I've become familiar with my usual server, Esther.

-The sushi rolls are pretty affordable. If you order sushi from other Japanese restaurants, I'm sure you're not able to get as good of a deal as here. My favorite is the Salmon Skin roll. 

-The dinner combos are very worth. My all time favorite is Combo C: chicken teriyaki & tempura. Each dinner combo comes with miso soup, a side of salad, and rice. Sometimes the beef here can be dry/too hard, depending on how busy the restaurant is.

This restaurant is ideal either for a dinner date or a family gathering. I would totally recommend making a reservation if you have a big table, because if you don't you'll have to wait. I've ate here since I was in a high chair, but I keep coming back because of the good food and of course, Esther!
author: Erica K.

description:
I'd have to say this is by far the most affordable Japanese place I have been to with pretty decent food! I've tried this place twice with my girlfriends for dinner! It's a pretty small restaurant so if you don't get there when they first open you might be waiting a while. 

I've ordered the beef amiyaki, Hawaiian roll, futomaki roll, and the spicy tuna roll. Each roll was about 4 bucks and the beef amiyaki was 14! My favorite dish is the beef amiyaki! It's almost like a teriyaki beef that's suuuupper tender! The spicy tuna roll was a little weird. It was basically a tuna roll with spicy tuna on top. The futomaki roll was also a little weird but not awful. 

My friends have ordered the chicken Katsu salad and I've tried a piece myself. It's actually really good with the honey mustard sauce! I'll definitely order it next time if I want something lighter!
author: Kelly S.

description:
If you sit-in, the experience is more like 3 stars (the restaurant is severely understaffed) but with takeout, you don't need to worry about all of that. Now that Yum Yum Fish on Irving is gone, Fujiyama-Ya has been my go-to for affordable Japanese food and we routinely get takeout from here. Since I come here so often, 4 stars feels about right (and I'm giving this rating without even having tried their signature beef amiyaki yet!)

The salmon (what the owners call "sha-ke") and escolar are usually good sashimi/chirashi options. The soft shell crab appetizer is a MUST order and has been consistently excellent--flavorful, juicy, and perfectly crunchy (then again it is crab season as I write this). The tuna poke isn't bad and I'll usually order this. As for rolls, I like the Rock 'n Roll and Pink Salmon Roll. For an extra $1 you can upgrade from artificial crab to real crab. Do it. 

There aren't a lot of no frills, reasonably priced sushi options in SF. This is a neighborhood treat, but expect your takeout order to take 45 min to 1 hour. I honestly wouldn't bother dining in unless you're coming during off-peak hours.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I have been to this restaurant two times now and each time I have gone I have not been disappointed. The special sushi rolls are very good and their terriyaki eel is on point. The restaurant space is small, so if you come during the busy hours, expect to wait for about an hour or so to get seated. The staff is very friendly and the food is served at a decent pace. I would come back here again the next time I am in the mood for eel or some good, affordable sushi.
author: Lynn T.

description: Parking was easy to find at night. Came here at 9pm there was no wait. This place is pretty small and the sushi is cheap but not great. I wouldn't return again. We got 16 pieces of sashimi but it was very thinly sliced LOL. We also ordered spicy tuna, sunset roll, and 49er roll. The bill total was 43$ not including tips. Also the sushi comes with miso soup and salad.
author: Tina C.

description:
I love this Japanese place! All the entrees, appetizers and other food seems authentic. It's good to come early before dinner rush cause it gets super packed quickly since the place is small. You can also make a reservation for a party of 2, very convenient. 

Whenever I come here, I love to try and order different rolls with my food. The katsu donburi is definitely my favorite. It also comes with a side of miso soup and salad with heavy dressing. The temperature is just right too while eating. The katsu skin isn't crispy but that's ok, the entree still has lots of flavors that blend well together. My second favorite item here is the vegetable tempura mix. 6 different veggies and worth it!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I was pretty disappointed with my meal here. 

First off, I had called days in advance to make a reservation but they forgot to put us down. Second, the food was not impressive at all and even something as simple as teriyaki beef was a C- at best. The beef was dry and the teriyaki sauce had this weird gelatinous texture that was simply unappetizing and unpleasant to mix with the rice. 

The soft shell crab appetizer we ordered for the table was so small that it could have been finished in 3 bites. The fish in the sashimi combo was fresh, but was sliced into such small pieces that even though it was a "16" piece sashimi combo, I got the equivalent of a 10 piece sashimi combo. 

I was really disappointed with my meal here, especially considering the fact that I love supporting local & family-owned restaurants here in the Sunset.
author: Winnie T.

description: Amazingly tasty Japanese cuisine, love the udon especially! Service is wonderful and everyone is so friendly!
author: Victoria P.

description:
I ordered the chirashi bowl, which was absolutely delicious in my opinion. While the slices of fish were not very large, the portioning was actually good enough to have a little bit of rice and steamed egg with every bite. The rice was seasoned well and very fluffy - as Japanese rice should be. Adding the bits of tamago and nori was an appreciated touch.

Dad ordered the Beef Amiyaki which was to die for tender! A definite order for steak lovers. Mom had the bento combo. It was fairly standard. The beef teriyaki was way overdone and very dry but luckily, the goyza and tempura vegetables were done nicely. A few slices of red tuna sashimi were also a nice touch.

Service was a bit slow on a Monday night. But other than that, it was still an enjoyable meal. Only Visa and Mastercard for credit cards. :)
author: Elaine Y.

description: By far, the worst sushi I've ever had. Skimpy, hard rice and the fish was warm. Totally disgusting.
author: Diego G.

description:
My colleague suggested this place, and boy was it a good choice after a long day at work! 

My colleague had made a reservation, and good thing she did since the place was packed around 7pm on a Wednesday! Out of all that we ordered, I recommend ordering the poki, dynamite roll, and the chicken kara-age. I would order their ribeye next time as many tables had ordered that and it smelled so good!

Service is a bit slow. They forgot our poki and hot sakes. Hopefully, this was a one-time mistake. Parking on Noriega may be difficult during peak dining hours. I can't wait to take my parents here! Delicious food at affordable prices!
author: Kristi T.

description:
Small place with a slow service.
The price is not expensive.
They forgot my friend's order once.
I got the bento with california roll.
California roll is almost dry.
author: Candice L.

description: Its an okay place for Sushi. I lived few blocks from this restaurant and decided to give this place a try. For Sushi is not bad but not impressive as well. For dinner is always busy even on weekdays, so expect some waiting time. They need to improve their customer service skill and be more friendly to customers and hire more staffs. The price is fair for this restaurant and I would recommend this place if you live nearby.
author: Trong T.

description: House special bento box and beef Amiyaki...what more can I say.   Good food and service always.
author: Jenny S.

description: Love this neighborhood sushi spot! Great food, very good service. Small inside but homey atmosphere. Would recommend to others.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Not sure why it's a big hit here... line out the door but maybe because it's very tiny inside.

Not much sushi options, very basic sushi the crunchy role wasn't much "crunch" just a tempura shrimp inside... what a let down. 

The staff doesn't check on you for water, food and appetizers are delayed (again not very busy inside.) 

The sushi was all very basic and edamame had no salt..

Boo... such a disappointment.
author: Lina T.

description: Always a pleasure to eat at this little hole I  the wall......pretty good in my opinion, it's not Anzu or any other high end establishment but for a local restaurant it will do just fine, if getting the rolls it's always recommended to pay the $1 more for real crab vs. Imitation, the bent box is pretty good also !!!
author: Johnny H.

description:
3 stars for my first experience here. 

There was a bit of a wait but luckily me and my friend got seated right away since it was just us 2. 

The waitresses were really attentive which was nice because it was kind of busy at the time. 

My friend ordered some chirashi and the fish didn't look too fresh O__o. It looked stiff and rubbery at the same time. 

I ordered the crunchy roll (shrimp tempura) and the dynamite roll (tuna with spicy mayo) and surprisingly they were not bad at all. They tasted really decent. I almost finished both of the rolls because I was really hungry. So I was satisfied with my order.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Fujiyama is a popular Japanese restaurant in the area, so it always has a long line. The interior is on the small side, about 10 tables, thus I sometimes get to-go instead. However, I found that their time for pick-up is usually longer than they tell you over the phone, so add another 10 minutes to the wait time they tell you. 

Price is really affordable for sushi around this area, and the variety is ok. My favorite from this restaurant is the spicy tuna roll, which is quite spicy. Other than spicy tuna, I always get the California roll and rock'n' roll. There is an option to replace artificial crab with real crab in the California roll, but I could not really tell the difference, so I would not pay extra to get the replacement again. I have also tried the seafood udon here, the amount of seafood is standard, with shrimp, mussel, some fish cake, etc. however, the soup base is blend and just not enough flavor. I would say it is an average udon. 

One time we came as a big party of around 10 people, with reservations made ahead, they were able to accommodate us at dinner time. They also give us complimentary miso soup too! Before this, they have always been rushed and now I appreciate their service. 

Given the price, I would come back again if I am craving Japanese food, or simply call in ahead of time to get to-go.
author: Karen C.

description:
Stumbled upon this budget friendly gem because my friends were craving sushi and saw this spot on Yelp with a relatively high rating. 

We came in with a party of five on a Saturday night and surprisingly got sat right away! The restaurant itself had a nice traditional feel to it and our orders were taken pretty promptly.

I decided to order the Chirashi dinner which was $12 and came with 12 pieces of fish on a bed of rice as well as soup and salad. My friends ordered some nigiri sushi which were charged per piece with the high end being $2.40 for Uni which was a pretty damn good deal!

So overall impression, if you're looking for top quality product, then this is probably not the place for you. But if you're a more budget conscience eater, than I would highly recommend this spot!
author: Marco M.

description: We have been coming to this place for over 23 years now. We moved to south bay, however, every time we visit San Francisco, this is where we eat and feel happy. There is a Japanese lady taking good care of us and other customers all these years and she still works there, sweet and caring as usual. We all love her very much. Food is yummy and fulfilling. I would give them all the stars.
author: A. A.

description: Mainly love this place because of how cheap everything is, but still is decent food. I got the spicy tuna roll and it had sriracha mayo on it, so it was prettyyyyyy good. And it was only like $4 for 6 pieces. I thought the udon was decent. Nothing amazingly special about it. Food also came out pretty fast.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Before you start reading this review, I want to mention that this place would definitely not be a destination restaurant in my opinion (meaning I wouldn't go here if I didn't live close by).

I've come here quite a few times and this is definitely not the place to come if you just want sushi, even though the option to be able to order sushi is nice.  The sukiyaki seems like the thing to get here, the udon soups are not bad, and the sushi is ok.

I feel that I have a hate love relationship with this place, just like 90% of the places that are close to me.  Of course I will be coming back at some point in the near future due to the fact that it's so close.

Pros
Free miso
Fairly good food

Cons
There is usually a wait
Service is so so
Sushi is mediocre even though the fish seems fresh


Overall this place barely meets the good standards In my opinion but a good place to have close by.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Made reservation for four. They seated us promptly. Miso soup and salad was good. A bit too much dressing on the salad though. The house special bento box was a good deal. Sashimi was small but fresh. We got salmon. 

The beef amiyaki was very tender. I thought it was a little lacking in flavor, but my friend said it was flavorful. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ agree to disagree, but I thought it was still good. 

For now, I'll say it's above average. Closer to 3.5 stars rather than 4, but I'll be generous. :)
author: Brandon L.

description: This place is amazing. Tiny cozy restaurant. Good selections of sushi, bento and udon. They always serve free miso soup. Will get five stars easily if they replace those over used plastic cups with new glass cups.
author: Derek L.

description:
Environment: Very cozy and tight spaced. Decor looked very nice though! However, it would be hard for someone with a wheelchair to get through. They do have a automatic assistance door. Plus for that!

Service: Slow when it's busy, but I honestly didn't mind. They can't seat a lot of people because the space is small. Therefore, not so many customers.

Food: It was okay. Not the best. Do not get the tempura Udon. The soup tasted like water. And it literally came with 3 slices of mushroom and a naruto (fishcake). The tempura didn't come till like halfway through the meal and we were almost done with the noodles. Pointless...
Their special sushis were not that special. Kinda plain. 

Price: Really good for broke college students like I myself.
author: Casey Y.

description:
Meh.
Read some good reviews so decided to try it while we were in the neighborhood.
They were treating their regulars really well, but not so much us...
Only had one menu between 2 people, said they would bring us another but didn't and then tried to take our order when both of us didn't get a chance to go through it.
I like that you can order nigiri by the piece instead of in pairs, but they're pretty thin slices vs places we're used to.
Everyone got salad except for us, they forgot our tea.
Overall just a meh experience.
author: Roni L.

description:
Arrived around 6:30 pm on a Sunday night. While approaching the front door, I saw a lot of ppl waiting patiently outside of this small restaurant. And I opened the door to see a white board and then I wrote my name down for 3 ppl. While my friends and I wait for about 30 mins or so, we were then seated inside of the restaurant. My impression of the menu was that the price ranged on the lower side of sushi restaurants. It is actually not bad, maki was about $4 for 6 rolls and nigiri was about $2 per piece and the special rolls are about $10-$12.

Then the waitress asked us to move to another booth because they had forgotten that someone made reservations on the big table. And when we moved to the side booths, we waited for 10 mins to finally put our orders in. And then we waited for 15-20 mins to get our food. 

Food quality: okay, nothing really special. The nigiri probably tasted the best out of everything. The maki roll was okay, I liked the tuna maki rolls. I don't recommend the special rolls because the sauces and other stuff on the sushi takes away from the freshness of the fish. So if you are into real raw fish, do give the hand rolls, maki and Nigiri a try. 

Overall my experience with this place is good. Just hope they can improve on the service and speed up the process instead of making us wait for a long time.
author: Joanne C.

description:
My go to cheap neighborhood sushi spot.  Service and quality isn't theee best but good enough, perfect when I'm craving raw fish and seaweed. 

Def coming back.
author: Elaine S.

description: Not bad. Something cheap quick and okay. Friendly service and staff also a clean environment.
author: Michele T.

description:
SMALLEST SUSHI ROLLS I"VE EVER EATEN.
Yeah it's cheap, but I thought they'd be at least edible size. THEY WERE SOOOO TINY!!!! 2 rolls equaled the size of 1 roll. I got a CA roll and Spicy Tuna. The California roll wasn't that great and I usually have really low standards for it. Spicy Tuna roll was good, but would've been better if it was FREAKING BIGGER.

What a waste of money.

Ginger pieces were old also.


Going back to KIKI's, never coming here again.
author: Hanna M.

description:
3.75

I like cheap haircuts...although sometimes I end up crying at home because the cut is too short
I like cheap sashimi...although sometimes the sashimi is bad or frozen

I ordered the Sashimi Special which comes with 16 pieces.  I didn't have high expectations for the food here but I did enjoy my dish except for the somewhat frozen tuna sashimi.

Kudos for the hot tea while I sat and waited for my friend.
author: Linda N.

description:
It's a small-ish restaurant with great sushi and sashimi.  The service is efficient yet courteous.  We'll come back again if we're in the Sunset area!

We started with agedashi Tofu which was delicious and served very hot with the sweet dashi/soy/mirin sauce.  We shared 2 orders which was perfect for our group.

We also had chicken karaage which was good but not great.  I'm still on the hunt for elusive great chicken karaage!

We had 3 orders of sashimi, chirashi (sashimi over rice in a bowl) and many different rolls.

Good value here for fresh sushi.  Will be back!
author: Susan C.

description: This place has a solid menu with excellent prices. Japanese food shouldn't cost more than what this place offers. I got the dinner bento box for $15. It has raw tuna, gyoza, tempura, and chicken teriyaki. Dinner came with miso, salad, and rice. I had a nice time eating here with my neighbors. They got the sukiyaki on a rainy SF day.
author: Denise C.

description: THEIR DRAGON ROLL WAS SO FRESH AND GOOD! Kind of pricey but the portion sizes are very generous and definitely took some leftovers home! Would highly recommend. Kind of a small seating area but not too cramped as other SF restaurants can be
author: Leslie T.

description:
I was craving sushi after a long day and this place had good reviews and near my house so decided to check it out. There was a bit of a wait around 6:30pm on a Thursday night. 

Service: Bad!!! Once we got seated, I could already tell the place was understaffed. All the servers seem flustered and rude. After receiving the menu, we had to waive them down to order and had to ask 3 times for water while waiting for our food. We didn't receive it until after our first dish came. 

Food: We ordered several rolls, tasty - but they all seemed to have similar taste. Fresh and yummy. Small portions but it's also reasonably priced so you get what you pay for. 

I was super hungry, super tired, and was just trying to get a good sushi fix but sadly, ended up very disappointed. I tried my best to be patient and sweet because having been a server myself and slammed with tables, I understand how it feels. But in addition to the slow service, I just got the vibe that the servers were upset with the workload, took it out on us and didn't seem apologetic.
author: Shana N.

description: I ordered the grilled teriyaki plate with mixed tempura. It wasn't bad, considering the price. The tempura was freshly made and it was perfect when dipped in sauce. I wouldn't say that the quality of the sushi is 10/10 though. There was a grilled beef plate that looked amazing and I think I'd come back for that. 3 stars for the food and atmosphere!
author: Christina P.

description: I eat at this lovely and homely establishment about once a week. The staff here is extremely friendly and on point. With the affordable pricing, the superb quality of food, and the hard-working staff, Fujiyama-Ya is one of my favorites spots in the city. Really amazing.
author: Cameron M.

description: The food here is good. I usually get a combo of chicken teriyaki and sukiyaki. It cost a little more (~$15) but it's a ton of food since you also get rice, miso soup and a salad! There always seems to be a wait when you come so be prepared to wait since it's a small little restaurant. My only complaint is that the service is a little slow and you have to get their attention rather than them coming and asking if you need anything else.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Fujiyama-Ya has been my home since the day I was born, literally. My parents stumbled on this place nearly 30 years ago when they first resided in the Sunset and my family has been coming to Fujiyama-ya ever since. This restaurant is my go-to spot. Whenever my family asks, "where do you want to eat tonight?" The answer is always Fujiyama-ya. My dad has his usual of Beef Amiyaki + Unagi, while my mom always has her usual of Combo E: Sukiyaki + Tempura. I would recommend going for their entrees over the sushi. The sushi here is good, but I think the entrees are more unique. Beef Amiyaki is a MUST TRY! 

When I went away for college and came back to the city during any holiday breaks, the first stop before heading home was Fujiyama-ya. It's nostalgic for me to eat here and if I were to recommend a restaurant in all of San Francisco, Fujiyama-ya is always my #1. Thanks for raising me, Fujiyama-ya!
author: Sabrina L.

description: Why this place is popular is beyond me. This restaurant is a hole in the wall so it's extremely cramped. I would definitely only get to go from this restaurant. Even getting to go was a horrible experience. Called ahead and was told 20 minutes. Came 25-30 minutes later. Upon opening the door, the entire entrance is packed with people waiting. You can't even get through. Upon getting through and to the cashier to pick up my order, no one acknowledges my existence. I tell the one and only waiter there that I am there to pick up. She tells me another person will help me out (a person who has had her back to me the entire time). I wait patiently and after messing around with to go orders, she finishes packaging a person's order. She gets his payment and passes him the bag of food to which he realizes there is no salad and has to remind her. It takes her another 5 minutes before asking me what me order was. Then once she takes my payment, she mentions we still have to wait for the tempura. Upon returning home and opening the food finally, the salmon teriyaki was BEYOND bad. It was over cooked like an extra 30 minutes and it had ZERO seasoning. Only watery teriyaki sauce. Not a piece of pepper or any seasoning on it. And it was the tiniest piece ever. The dynamite roll tasted only of the seasoning. The inside of it tasted like nothing. The chicken katsu sauce tasted like soy sauce only. The only good part was the tempura. It had the right amount of crispness and dough. Would not come back due to the service, portioning, and lack of ability to make things taste decent.
author: Jessica W.

description: This was on my bucket list for awhile now and the wifey happen to be free for early dinner so we decided to finally give this place a try. First there was a wait which was about 15 mins but not too bad. We enjoyed the sunset roll, 16 piece sashimi combo and beef amayaki (which was highly recommended on yelp). Everything was delicious, just smaller portions. So if you're wondering why the sushi is so cheap, it's because it's smaller than your usual sushi joint. But I like that the fish was fresh!
author: Toro C.

description: Precious hole in the wall! I got the Beef Amiyaki which was sooo good and only $15! Comes with rice, miso soup, and small side salad. Definitely will be back.
author: Ava M.

description:
Wavering between 2&3 stars here, but I'll stick with three because I didn't have a necessarily bad experience here.

Walked in at 6:30 on a Monday. No wait.

Got seated at a table, and got one menu for the two of us. We were there less than 5 mins before someone came to take our order. Since we only had the one menu, we felt rushed - but still ordered.

Sushi rolls were ok. Nigiri had very very small pieces of fish. Shrimp Tempura roll was very average. Spicy Tuna was fresh and spicy!

Service was rushed and not very friendly. Food came out quickly though.

If I was hungry and walking by, I might stop in again - but with all the good sushi places around here, I wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Comfort Japanese food but I'm DISAPPOINTED by the quality.

FOOD: My friend and I shared 1) Fujiyama roll ($10 - 8 pieces) and 2) combo w/ beef amiyaki + chicken kaarage ($16.95). The Fugiyama roll was PRETTY SALTY and I was not too impressed. Not sure what type of fish was inside but it was fried, and the sushi was topped with caviar. The beef amiyaki was pretty disappointing, since it had a really flour-y texture, despite it looking really impressive on a stone top. The chicken kaarage also tasted really greesy and very floury. The best part was probably the salad dressing... 

PRICE: With tips/tax we paid $33 total ($16.50/person), which is reasonable for Japanese restaurant but I was disappointed with the quality of the food - that it was too salty and the meat tasted really cheap. 

SERVICE: We came in a big party (10 people) and our food came by within 10-15 minutes of our ordering, which is impressive. Gotta give them credit for that.

SETTING: The restaurant is located in the outer sunset neighborhood, so street parking is definitely do-able. The shop is pretty small though - 7-8 tables and can seat 25 people max. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Not too impressed by the quality of the food. Maybe I am not a big fan of Japanese food to start with...
author: Wendy F.

description:
Went there with a friend on a Sunday evening at around 7-7.30pm, it was a short wait that evening. Was seated in about 20 minutes or so. 

Had the combo special and it was very worth the $$. I got the beef sukiyaki and sashimi set (7 pieces, choice of tuna or salmon, cannot mix) and it only came up to about $15. The beef sukiyaki was a large portion itself and came with a generous serving of beef together with other stuff like vegetables. The salmon sashimi was fresh. I mean, a usual serving of sashimi would set you back $9 in the city so do the math and realize that this is an amazing deal. 

Service was pretty ok, it's a busy place so there is a small wait when I requested for a saucer for soy sauce but the wait was definitely not excruciatingly bad. I'm giving it 5 stars because of value and quality of food and the fact that service was still present in this place albeit slightly slow. This shall be my go-to place for japanese food around the sunset area.
author: Erica Y.

description: Cheap and delicious food. Great service. Attentive staff. What more can I ask for? My favorite dish here is their teriyaki salmon. I love how their sauce is subtle and not over powering like most places. Their Uni is oh so fresh. You can tell by the vibrant yellow color it has. Usually not a long wait and fairly easy parking. Great spot to enjoy some Japanese food at.
author: Ada H.

description:
I've been craving and missing my favorite sushi places in San Mateo.  So he and I decided to get sushi for dinner one weekday night.  Of course we didn't want to trek far so we were limited to the Sunset.  We decided on Fujiyama-Ya.  

This place seems like a small operation ran by family which kind of makes me sad to give such a low review.  But the service was slow and forgot our waters and things several times.  The agedashi tofu was lackluster.  We ordered 4 sushi rolls which were bland as well.  Only one, even out of the three specialty rolls we ordered, were satisfying.  And that one was the spicy tuna topped with a creamy sauce.  Prices are affordable, but that won't cut it for us.  I guess I may just have to save sushi for a San Mateo weekend.
author: Cat C.

description: This Place is in a Word -  Da Bomb  .  Favorite Neighborhood Japanese Restaurant Bar None . Maybe a Bit  $$$ , But Well Worth It . Weather it Teriyaki  , Tempura  , Specialty Rolls , Sushi n Sashimi - You Won't be Disappointed.  Get Here Early , When the Restaurant Opens or be Prepared to Wait During Peak  Hrs . The Only Negative is  ' Limited  Seating  . Suck it  Up , Because It's Worth It  - Trust Me .
author: Gerry L.

description:
I came here with a group of 3 on a weekend for an early dinner.

We ordered the beef and chicken teriyakis, along with a few rolls of sushi. The teriyaki plates were not that great. The sauce on the teriyaki plates was very heavy, and the beef was very chewy. The rolls were okay, but not very memorable.

The service was very slow, but the prices were affordable, especially for SF.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Foods I have tried:

-$12.95 Combo K (Unagi Teriyaki and Salmon Sashimi): 
Comes with the soup, salad, and rice.

Proportions are HUGE compared to other Japanese restaurants. The salad dressing was delicious and the soup wasn't too salty but the tofu tasted weird. The rice came in those rice buckets and you could scoop however much you wanted into your bowl. The Unagi Teriyaki and Salmon Sashimi were pretty good but the salmon's texture was a bit gooey. My friend had the Chicken Teriyaki and it was pretty good and standard.

The restaurant is small and had only 2 waitresses working when we went on a Friday night. Service is slow because the waitresses were busy running back and forth. I think it would be more efficient if there were another worker who could prepare all the tea, soups, salads, and rice and have the waiters take them to the customer, since the place would be too cramped for 3 waiters walking around.
author: Alice C.

description: The food is cheap and not bad, but the wait for the food was sooo long. We must have waited at least 20-30 minutes for regular cheap sushi! At least I had good company.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Totally average sushi.  This is a cute neighborhood family run spot, but I was disappointed by the food.  With four stars on yelp, I thought the sushi would be better, but it was just average.  Too much rice in the rolls, not well rolled, fake crab instead of real, fine, but nothing special.
author: Kathryn H.

description: Went on a Wednesday night, around 8pm with my brother who was visiting  from out of town.  We both ordered off the sushi menu and each got some rolls.  Good, fresh sushi, and reasonably priced.
author: David C.

description: Cozy, neighboorhood restaurant with nice ambience. Come early as it tends to get busy after 7 pm. Food quality / price is good for Japanese food. The house dinner special is large size and fulfilling. The fish on the nigiri and freshness and quality was average, but still ok as many restaurants in SF would charge 2X for the same dish and quality.
author: William J.

description: Ordered the Katzu Donbhri. Decent price, decent portions. Food tastes pretty good. Love the tea - tastes kind of like a gemaicha tea i think. Has a mom & pop feel and very cozy. Place is kind of small though, so there are long waits sometimes.
author: Sarah P.

description: What started out with so much promise ended up falling short. When I saw a Japanese restaurant with 4+ stars in my neighborhood, I nearly jumped for joy. SF isn't known for their Japanese food, and good Japanese is just a myth. I have yet to find it in this big city. The portions are hearty, it's so affordable! But you get what you pay for. Unfortunately, quality was pretty low and left a lot to be desired. While I think I will come here to satisfy my craving for Japanese food (because of proximity and affordability) this restaurant had no WOW factor. When we asked how long the wait was, the waitress just pointed to the sign in and didn't really help us further. The should have been a red flag. I will give this place one thing, their menu was extensive! However, that can also be their greatest weakness because quality fell through the cracks.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
My favorite little mom & pop shop sushi place!
I haven't been here in around 2 years. (I discovered this place my freshmen year of college when I had a sushi addiction!) But this place hasn't changed one bit!
We came in right around opening time (5:15ish) and were seated immediately! I know there's usually a wait though because the restaurant is very small and can't seat too many people.
Our service was impeccable. They listened and were always checking up on us. We were served our food moderately fast. I felt like I was waiting a while but it was probably just because I was hungry, lol.
I usually get the chirashi dinner which is very good but I saw the Katsu donburi on the menu and had to try it!
Food was so good. It tastes like comfort food that you want to eat on a cold rainy day or when you're sad. For those of you who don't know what Katsu donburi is, it's breaded chicken with a house sauce and cooked with egg over rice and onions! Delicious! The chirashi dinner my boyfriend got never fails me. My boyfriend also split one Uni roll. Just adequate, wouldn't order again.
My donburi was $7.95 and boyfriend's chirashi dinner was $11.95. Uni was $2.40. Great value for the amount of food you get! I had leftovers.

I've been here over 5 times and am never disappointed. Will be returning. Thanks for making me a loyal customer!
author: Alexi G.

description:
Fujiyama-Ya has the style of a small, family-run restaurant.  It's cozy and has wooden decor with traditional paintings.  To complete the theme, I believe the waitresses even wear those traditional smocks with Japanese designs.  

The miso soup is standard, but the salad is one of the better ones I've had as a complimentary part of a meal.  The lettuce was fresh and crunchy, and instead of that generic Japanese mayo they used a unique dressing that was honey-mustard like, but Asian.

I got the saba teriyaki ($9), and at first I was disappointed because it looked small.  It was quite filling though, and of good quality though somewhat on the salty side.  My friend got the popular beef amaki, which she liked a lot.  Basically it's similar to kalbi, served sizzling on teppan, only it's larger cuts of beef.

I have yet to try their sashimi--at first I was skeptical because of the surprisingly low prices ($12 chirashi?!?!).  However the restaurant and my saba seem legit enough that it's worth a try.  

Tip: It's a small place, so avoid peak hours if you don't want to wait.

Tip #2: The entrees come with soup, salad, and rice not just the meat.  (This was a big relief to me because I get annoyed when I have to order my own rice and wince in embarrassment when waiters look at me funny for ordering curry on its own.)
author: Edna C.

description: Good place for the price! Most of the nigiri is priced at under $2 for one piece. Came in on a Sunday night an hour and a half before closing and ordered the deluxe sushi combo, the sushi combo B, uni nigiri, and the tempura udon. Uni nigiri was decently fresh although portions weren't huge. Keep in mind tho it was only a little over $3. So it's a great deal. Sushi combos were good for the price. The tempura udon was the most meh item, and that's only because the tempura was super super oily. Yeah, it's deep fried, but instead of it being crispy and airy, it was so oily ): overall, good place for cheap sushi!
author: Sandy K.

description:
The place is a nice hold-in-the-wall in the Sunset District of SF.  Inside is a bit cramped, but a nice cozy feel overall.

I ordered the teriyaki salmon and the tempura; the salmon was good but the teriyaki glaze was the standard you normally find at typical Japanese restaurants.  The tempura batter was a bit denser than my ideal batter (light and crispy), but not bad.  The spicy tuna roll was good though! 

Overall, not a bad place to eat when you're hungry and looking for an impromptu spot, but nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary.
author: Ian T.

description: Cheap, but of course also low quality food. Very simple looking food that you can make at home. Bad and slow service - they literally just put the food down without a word and move on. Will not be back!
author: Miranda T.

description: Good food. Service was excellent. The karage is a must have. The beef amiyaki was excellent , came sizzling on an iron plate .
author: Thai S.

description:
Upon walking in, I was not impressed. The restaurant is small and seemed really dirty. Our table was a bit sticky, and the chairs and booth were crumb-infested. 

Best thing though are the prices!! Super affordable- around $12 for a dinner combo (TWO protein choices!, rice, soup, salad), and as low as $3 for rolls. I ordered the chicken teriyaki & sashimi combo. The chicken was nice and crispy at the edges, but not overly oily. The teriyaki sauce was gross though- super thick. The bf ordered the chirashi dinner. Came with a good amount of mixed sashimi. 

Service was just okay. They gave us the wrong order, and took it back before even confirming with us if it was the right order. She just snatched it.. RUDE! Nor did she ask if we had touched the dish yet.. GROSS! 

Would come back because of the affordable prices, but definitely not my #1 pick for Japanese food in the area.
author: Samantha C.

description: I thought it was good. Not the best place I've ever been to but it was satisfying. Will have to go back when feeling better as I wasn't up to par and couldn't eat that much. That way I can do a better or worse review. Plus doing this review from hospital bed so not fully into it...will definitely update later.
author: Austin C.

description: Clearly family run and so not efficient. Small pieces of fish though cheap. Forgot our appetizers and one nigiri we ordered. They need to step up their game. Hey kids of this family, stand up and make this place as good as it could be. Your parents are not going to want to step out of the way but it's necessary as you could triple your profit at this location and make the place thrive!
author: Priya S.

description: By far my favorite sushi spot. Expect a short wait. The restaurant is small and popular. It's worth going to just for the prices alone. You can get so much sushi at the fraction of the price compared to other restaurants. Their deluxe combo consists of 2 rolls and 7 sashimi for only $11 !! Rolls are cheap as $3. Food quality is good, as well. So if you are close to the Mosaic Steps, you should eat here while you are in the area
author: Dana D.

description:
My friends and I decided to go here for our little get together reunion. I've been wanting to try this place for awhile now so I was looking forward to our dinner. But I felt I was a little disappointed tonight. 

I ordered the pink salmon roll and the spicy scallop roll. The pink salmon roll was a California roll topped with baked salmon and drizzled mayo. I thought this roll was pretty good. The salmon was well done and it gave the California roll a little something extra. The spicy scallop was what disappointed me. It was a roll with scallop inside topped with spicy seasoning. What really surprised me was the scallop. I don't eat raw fish. It's just not my thing. But I love sushi rolls so when I order rolls, I order ones that are fully cooked. I order scallop rolls often so I figured it was safe. When I bit into the roll, I noticed that it tasted a little slimy and when I looked at the scallop, it was raw. It's just my preference, but I didn't like what I had tonight.

I did like that they gave us complimentary miso soup and a container of rice, similar to those at Chinese restaurants. We get to divide rice among us however we like. The prices for the rolls and for entrees are also pretty cheap. 

I was not impressed with the service. I felt that the lady who served us was just unhappy the entire time. She looked like she wanted to be anywhere else but there. And when she brought our orders out, she didn't know what it was that we ordered. She was like, "It's either a Fujiyama Roll or a Crunchy Roll."

Since no one at our table ordered the Crunchy Roll, it had to be the Fujiyama Roll. 

Maybe it was an off day for them. Or maybe it's just my preferences. But I feel like I could get better sushi elsewhere. I might or might not return. But if I do, I think I'll try the chicken teriyaki or the chicken amiyaki.
author: Andrea G.

description: If you're looking for good and cheap Japanese food, Fujiyama-ya is the spot to go to. They have the usual rolls and several bento box options. I recommend getting the rib eye; tender, juicy and tasty. The grilled squid is great as well. I usually like sushi rolls, yet this place was not as good. They cut their sashimi thinner than your usual Japanese restaurant. Service is aways on point and food is excellent.
author: Jan R.

description:
Two words: Cheap sushi. I stopped by for the first time a while back, and I've gone back almost every other week! The quality is very good, and the owner (I'll assume the older woman is the owner) is always very friendly and attentive to patrons. They also do combination plates, which are pretty decent; however, I always order nigiri and a bunch of rolls to share! It can get pretty busy sometimes, but never busy enough that you'll be waiting forever. They also do takeaway, but I've noticed that I always want more food, and it's so much harder to get up after I've been eating at home for more (seriously, first world problem).

I have a tendency to take my friends here when we have no idea what to eat for dinner as it seems there's something for everyone to eat.

Atmosphere: 8/10
Food: 8/10
Service: 8/10
Overall: 8/10
author: Evan K.

description:
Pros: It's got an older Japanese restaurant charm to it. It's like they never left the 90s which as a millennial, I can appreciate for the nostalgic feel. The price is super, especially for the quality and taste! The rice they recommend us pair our sashimi with is too good! The aroma of the rice gently snuggles into my nose, the sweetness lightly sprinkles across my taste pallete and the fluffiness cushions my every bite. The sashimi is pretty good, nothing to get super excited about, nonetheless it was good. The service was excellent too. My tea pot was always full and they would always make their rounds to check in every customer. 

Cons:  They could update their menus. It's pretty old and used up. It's about time to bring in a fresh one that doesn't look like thousands of people have touched it.
author: Andy L.

description:
Fujiyama-Ya isn't exactly your typical Japanese Restaurant.  Granted, they have the usual staples like Teriyaki Chicken, Tempura, and your usual Sushi selections.  But I do not go there for any of those.  I go there for the Beef Amiyaki!

There are certain nights when I have that crave for a good steak but I don't feel like cooking.  Their Beef Amiyaki takes care of that!

Beef Amiyaki
http://bit.ly/ZuMDa8
You really have to try this!  $12 for 7-8oz Marinated Ribeye Steak is a steal!  I love how it comes out of the kitchen all sizzling on a cast iron pan and you can totally smell the awesome aroma coming from it.  It's nicely marinated and does have a little bit of a Korean Bulgogi BBQ taste to it as other yelpers have mentioned.  I've had this both times I've visited and both times it was awesome!  This is my must-order entree and I'll probably order it again every time I'll be going back there,

And based on what I've read from other reviews, I've also tried their Soft Shell Crab.

Soft Shell Crab
http://bit.ly/YnY843
This was different for me n that I've never have had Soft Shelll Crab served to me in this way.  It's a lot smaller than it looks in the pic, but it's really meant to be an appetizer anyways.  Pretty good stuff, nicely fried, and at lot of flavor.  Plus it's fun to eat!

And yes, I've also tried some of usual Japanese food staples mentioned earlier:

Mixed Tempura
http://bit.ly/ZuN5VV

Gyoza
http://bit.ly/Y3Mpu4

Sushi Special Combo - maguro, hamachi ebi, tako, tamago, tekka maki, california roll
http://bit.ly/1479CwB

They're all pretty much okay.  Good, but not enough to blow your mind.  These are more like side dishes when ordered with the Beef Amiyaki, so they do compliment it very well.

Fujiyama-Ya probably isn't a restaurant for everyone if they want really good sushi or bento boxes.  But for a different experience, definitely go for the Beef Amiyaki and Sof Shell Crab and you'll definitely get your money's worth!
author: Rodney H.

description:
I came here on a Saturday around 7pm for dinner. It was around a 15 minute wait. I wrote my name down on the white board and waited to be called. Once I was seated I was given the menu. The ambiance of the place was very cozy. However, the service could be better. Flagging down a waiter to order food was difficult and the food didn't come out as quickly as I would have liked, but I guess it's understandable since it was during the dinner rush and all the waiters were busy attending to other tables. I ordered a spider roll, a rock and roll, two yellowtail maki, dragon roll, and a dynamite roll. The waiter forgot the dynamite roll so she had to be reminded twice. It came out eventually. The taste of the rolls were good (10/10), but the presentation was lacking (7/10). All in all I really enjoyed my meal here and I would come back again :)

PS. They gave miso soup for FREE before the meal
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Amiyaki! I never care to look at their menu ever since i tried their Amiyaki maybe 6 or 7 years ago. Ever since, I had only ordered this item. Perhaps the most delicious ribeye for its price. Juicy and tender, yum!  Oh, their salad, included with the entree, is also delicious. Mainly because of the dressing. I asked if they sell them in a bottle, but they don't :(  

 They can be slow some time. Glad to see some additional young staff recently, much faster service compare to before.
author: Raymond L.

description:
Great prices and selection. We got some nigiri, the dragon roll, tempura, and the sizzling rib eye plate that comes with soup and salad I think. 

We liked the sizzling rib eye the best and were totally full because we ordered to much. haha
author: Steph N.

description:
I've been to this restaurant with my friend numerous of time, and had a really good experience for a small but cozy restaurant.

I've always get sushi which it was fresh and perfection. And I even had the tempura udon, which it was a hearty meal.
 
Sometime we get the green tea ice cream but on busy days, they're usually our of green tea ice cream. But can't complain about that as long as I'm  statified with the meal.

I suggest to come in early around 5 or you'll wait at least an hour to get a table.
author: Cindy G.

description:
My mom waned to go out and eat with me since my dad was out playing MJ and Fujiyama-Ya was open on Memorial Day.  I took my mom here around 5:15 PM and we got seated right away.  A little soon after, it got pretty packed.  

We ordered a chirashi (16 pcs), Deluxe Assorted sushi, and a spider roll.  Shortly after we got miso soup and salad.  My mom and I both liked the orange sauce they put on the salad, it was a little tangy and full of flavor.  The rice tea was also very enjoyable.  

The spider roll came out first and it was okay, mainly just the soft shell crab with not much else in it.  (should've just gotten the soft shell crab appetizer).  The assorted sushi had a good variety, but nothing really stood out, same with the chirashi bowl.  

All in all, it was a decent place, nothing to complain about and nothing extraordinary either.  I would come back to try the bento boxes to see how their cooked foods are!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Great sushi today. The fish was super fresh. Last time I came here, it wasn't as great but it definitely has improved. This place operates by 2 waitresses and I can say they are pretty good. The place was packed and we had a great satisfying dinner.

I order the Charshi Combo/ 16 pieces only 13.95, salmon lover roll and seaweed salad, and My bf had the Combo F --TIP: just ask for salmon sashmi or they would give you the tuna sashmi.

Bill came to be around $40.00, great deal!
author: Foodie B.

description:
Esther has been here forever and is the one bright spot. She's really nice. I'll give one extra star for that. Otherwise the other waitresses seem to come and go and are very inexperienced. 
I went tonight and it took 30 minutes to get tea and take our order. After waving my hand around to get her attention. It's a very small place so that shouldn't have happened. Then another 30 for the first dish to come out. Then another 30 min for the next dish. They totally forgot my sushi order. So I decided to cancel it. Food is ok here. The beef teriyaki is sub par. But the beef amiaki is good. Sushi and sashimi are just ok here. 

They seem to cater more to their take out customers as I saw multiple folks in and out picking up their orders. And stacks and stacks of Togo boxes piling up. But I guess I'm a service guy. Customer service is a big thing. Maybe it was an unusually busy night. But still. I won't be going back again.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Tonight we ordered 6 pieces of white tuna sashimi and OMG IT WAS SO AMAZING. It was really smooth and  melts in your mouth!!! 
We also ordered a our usual sushi rolls which were spicy scallop roll, rock and roll, and philadelphia roll! 
This place is absolutely lovely!!!
author: Sophia L.

description: Such an amazing place. Been here three times and does not fail to deliver great food and good service. Line was long the first time I came (which was a busy Friday night), granted, we finally got our table of three and waited for our server. The food was excellent, especially the Beef Amiyaki! That is the best dish if you are looking for a meat plate! Unfortunately though, the second time I came the beef amiyaki was poorly cut and we got the fatty bits of the steak, instead of the juicy thin slices. We told our waitress and she apologized and noted that she would let the chef know. Otherwise, the sushi is superb and we definitely enjoyed our time here!
author: Sophia N.

description:
Just got back from this place, celebrating my dad's birthday. The food was awesome but the service was pretty much a downer, unfortunately. I understand that to some people, service is not a necessary thing as long as the food is great -- but I'm the kind of person where it needs to have a little bit of both; great service and great food. 

There were five of us -- two ordered udons and the other three ordered the combos, along with a side plate of vegetable tempuras -- but we made a mistake of instead of ordering the appetizers, we ordered a meal instead. I asked the waitress to change the order but it seems like it was hard to communicate because she doesn't seem to understand when I asked her to change the order to regular appetizer -- that took a few minutes to settle. And it's funny how every time the same waitress would hand our food, she would place it on the corner then walks off (to me, that just seems weird and not a good sight because anyone can knock it down). There wasn't a time, where the waitress would ask us, if the food is good or even check on us, the only time I would see her near our table is to bring us food and take the plates away from us, but that's it! 

Overall, like I mentioned earlier, the food was yummy (my dad was satisfied) -- I would come back here, to try their sushi because for the price, it is very reasonable! And I would suggest to come as soon as they open because the place is pretty small and there was a few groups waiting while we were enjoying our meal.
author: Carmen W.

description: Service is slow. Tasted soap in my food probability because they didn't rinse their dishes enough. Won't be going back.
author: A C.

description: I love this place.  Can't beat the price and the quality of food.  The sukiyaki and salmon is very good.  It can get crowded but Ester and the other waitress does a good job getting to everyone.
author: Peter L.

description: If I could give them zero stars I would. This place surely has affordable sushi prices but that comes at the price of being understaffed. Being understaffed has taken the voice away from their waiters. After waiting 1 hour and 20 minutes, we are finally next in line with an open table awaiting us. A lady comes in and has a seat at that open table. Her name is no where to be found on the wait list and she does not say a word to anyone. When us waiting customers bring this to the waitresses' attention, being so busy, she does not say a word. She simple allows them to sit and begins to serve them. Very disappointed in the morals of the staff. Although it is easier to avoid the situation that to do what's right, you would think this restaurant would try their best to be fair. Don't come here unless you have reservations in advance or the wait could potentially be 1+ hours during dinner time.
author: Connie S.

description:
I came to Fujiyama-Ya for dinner and enjoyed this family ran resturant. I have been searching for some quality beef sukiyaki and finally found it. Each order is served with a salad topped with miso dressing, miso soup and hot tea. 

The beef sukiyaki was wonderful. The broth was perfect. It was not salty nor too sweet. The beef sukiyaki was prepared with glass noodles, fish cake, tofu and mushrooms. It is served with rice. 

I also ordered the Alaska roll. There Alaska roll is made with salmon, avocado and masago. The salmon was fresh and of great quality. 

Service was friendly and quick. I can't wait to return to try other items on their menu.
author: Annie V.

description: This neighborhood gem is good for comfort Japanese food with great prices.  The selection is good and the place fills up fast due to a small place.  There are six booth settings and four tables.  The service is is a bit slow along with the kitchen staff that has a hard time keeping up with the orders.  Be patient and enjoy the ambiance and good food.
author: J S.

description:
Intimate spot that's never too crowded on a weeknight and convenient for those near Noriega and 19th. And it's delicious!

I'm a huge fan of their caterpillar roll (eel, cucumber, avocado), rock & roll (unagi, avocado), Alaskan roll (salmon, avocado), and spicy tuna roll. If I split sushi with someone I'll usually leave absolutely stuffed for just over $20.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Got there on a Friday night at 6pm and there was not wait. The waitress was very attentive and our food came out quickly.

Great price and plenty of selections
author: Grace T.

description: This place is my favorite place to get sushi. It's small but the food is delicious and the waitresses are all very sweet. You get free miso and green tea with your meal. It can get a little crazy sometimes and you may have to wait for a little bit, but it's worth it.
author: Emilia K.

description: 49r rolls are meh, fish were fishy, dynamite was good, dragon roll was ordinary, ca rolls with real crab was not  bad, tempura was meh.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Love this place! It's small, but worth the wait if you get there during peak dinner service hours. Totally reasonably priced and the service is quick. 

The bento boxes are pretty big and more than filling. The Nigiri is priced per piece with most coming under $2.00, and though the portions are slightly smaller the quality of the fish is still good. The teriyaki beef and chicken weren't the greatest I've ever had, but overall this place is a great deal.
author: Rose F.

description: Incredibly cheap prices, but you lose a little with small serving sizes and teeny, thin slices of sashimi. Still one of the more affordable and authentic sushi places in sf, but there are too many better alternatives in the sunset for me to be a regular here.
author: Shawna C.

description: One of my favorites! I remember coming here 25 years ago as a kid and it's still just as good as I remember. The sushi is great. I especially love the yakiniku. The udon is also really good. I'm so glad to see they're still busy as ever!
author: CJ J.
