Oh, and I think our meals comes with complimentary miso soup. The beef was good, it wasn't over cooked or tough like some other places. I like their salad dressing on their salad. Tempura is ok, but I don't really like tempura by itself anyway. The crunchy roll was good also. And who can beat the $2.95 six piece spicy tuna roll! That is definitely a bang for your buck! 

The total came out to be around $22 excluding tip. I like this place better than Noriega Teriyaki. Even though this place is a lot smaller, the prices and the food are a lot better than Noriega Teriyaki. 

Oh yeah, there is a Japanese painting that looks like some guy is peeing off the balcony. I'm pretty sure other yelpers have caught on, because they have uploaded pictures on this site. haha
author: Julie L.

description: I like this place and have been there a couple of times.  It's a pretty small place and you may have to wait if they're busy.  It feels pretty homey.  They use to have fish katsu on the menu which isn't that common at other Japanese restaurants.  I wanted to try the Beef Amiyaki which had good reviews, but when I was there I saw that it just looked like a piece of steak (too much meat), so instead, I went for the beef sukiyaki which was good.  It was also a lot of food and I had leftovers.
author: S Y.

description: We love this place. We've been coming here for over 20 years!. Everyone is so nice and the food is excellent. we've tried the sushi, sashimi, and especially love the beef amiyaki. oh yum!  my whole family loves this place. one of the few authentic japanese restaurants around! wish we lived closer so we could go there more often!
author: L T.

description: Solid Japanese fare and sushi place, at a really good price. Been four or five times, and a two person check, with booze, is still only like 20-25 bucks. Last night I just go sushi and I thought it was really good. I'm not pretending to be a sushi aficionado, but I got the snapper and the yellowtail and they were both really good. The spicy tuna roll had a little bit too much of the spicy sauce stuff, but the flavor of the tuna was really good. Domestic beer only 1.95 a bottle!! and 2.95 for a bottle of Japanese import, or six for a big one. The service is always friendly and efficient, and they don't rush you in and out. I have noooo idea if their sushi is top notch or not, but I can walk here from my place and I've never had to wait. Really like it here.
author: Christopher V.

description: Get anything but the udon. The udon I had was flavorless. Everything else...is good. My mom especially likes their sukiyaki and orders the combination of sukiyaki and chicken teriyaki, the portions for this are bigger to go than dining in.  Either way you'll get full, and it'll be a good full. The food is good, the waitress is really sweet, and the prices are low.
author: Tiff L.

description: Just walking into this cozy establishment, you feel the family-run atmosphere.  The food is abundant, and the Beef Donburi and Unagi is fantastic, as well as the Sashimi.  Good service, warm, comfortable, and affordable, its great to have good Japanese food in the Sunset.
author: Carli F.

description: Love this place.  The food is always good, and the service has always been great.  Ester is usually the person who serves us and she's always pleasant to deal with.  The bento boxes are great, lots of value here.  The donburi bowls taste great and we really like the sushi rolls.  This place gets crowded at times so plan ahead if you're in a hurry.  Parking can also be a challenge at times too.
author: Dan L.

description: I love sushi and tempera. This place is great for the price. I usually get the sushi rolls, but I steer away from any fish that contain fish bones, i.e. tuna, salmon, etc. My boss recommended this place and I enjoyed eating here my first time. The second time, I found a fish bone in one of my rolls, thus I stay away from the sushi rolls containing fish with bones. My favorite roll is Golden California roll. I usually order the tempera as well. I tend to eat the shrimp and broccoli tempera (and zucchini tempera if they serve it) and let my bf eat the other veggie tempera. The service is pretty good as well. The teriyaki chicken was alright, but the teriyaki sauce was gooey texture. It tasted okay but wasn't visually appealing. Other than that, it's a cheaply priced place for sushi and other various Japanese cuisine. It's definitely worth a try.
author: J L.

description: Do you remember that scene in Ratatouille where Anton Ego eats the dish prepared by Remy the rat...Anton gets thrown back to his childhood where everything just made sense and emotions still existed? Yeah, it's kinda like that. Ha. But in all seriousness, Fujiyama-Ya is quite possibly the best home cooked Japanese food that I have eaten and comfortably afforded in San Francisco. Upon viewing the outside of the restaurant you might be scared away by the local patrons at the Eagles dive bar (which is amazing...) but don't be, they are harmless. Also pay no mind to the other empty restaurants on the block; Fuji's has them all. The sushi is always fresh and top quality, the miso soup is always perfect and just warm enough, and to finish it off, the service is next to family status. My girlfriend is a fan of the spicy tuna roll, miso soup and the salad dressing. I must agree; those items are very well done. For those that wish to find a little bit of grandma's cooking, try the Sukiyaki and the Chicken dombori just like grandmas. The price is cheap, if your putting on a collard shirt and stepping into a sushi bar that involves more music and neon lights than it does Japanese people...get out of there and find yourself a new club in north beach, because your paying to much for edible fashion. This place reminds me of everything that I have done right in life, with that said...do it to it.
author: Patrick K.

description: I love this place because of it's cozy feel of being at home. It is run by a mom and pop which is cute. This place makes the best agaedashi tofo so far from everyone sushi i've been too. The price is right on just about every selection. The only problem is when it is crowded due to the space here.
author: Kevin N.

description: One of my favorite home-cooked Japanese restaurant. I love their Beef amiyaki and Sukiyaki, I always order this combination.  The lady is so nice, she always bring me green tea ice cream for dessert. ^_^
author: San S.

description: we picked this place based on other yelpers reviews. we found generous portions and reasonable prices. the Calif Maki (Avocado, Real Crabkeat) was made of crab salad, which threw me off, but it wasn't bad. the Shrimp Tempura were exceptionally long, and had a sweetish dipping sauce.   Yakiniu was well marinated with an interesting medley of vegetables - eggplant and asparagus were particularly good. the Chicken Amiyaki was not exceptional, but most pieces were moist and sweet. i'll try the beef next time. the miso soup and salad that started the meal were standard, but  a nice start to the meal. the hot tea was tasty, but i will order a sake next time.
author: Char Z.

description:
beef amiyaki...beef amiyaki.... and beef amiyaki... 
the nicest ladies... ive gone once every few months and they always remember me and my order...
great place for a good meal without a crazy atmosphere....
it does take a bit longer to get your food but thats part of the character of small family owned restaurants...
author: Usmaan A.

description: Just love this place. Its a tiny restaurant but crammed with delicious food. The owners are super friendly and the price is definitely not expensive for the quality of food you get. Every time I go here, there's a line. My hubby and I love to order the warm Saka to go with our meal and of course the soft shell crab. This has become one of our common eating spots.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Pretty good food, reasonably priced, large portions. They offer some harder to find items. Cool decor and unusual compared to most Japanese restaurants. No pressure to leave (even though business was slow). Just watch out when you pay. We paid with cash and waited for the longest time for our change...which never came. Even when the waitress gave us our take home boxes and thanked us for coming, she never batted an eye. Pay with credit card or exact change.
author: Hoola H.

description: i've been going here for over 6 years! i couldn't find this other japanese restaurant i was looking for and i ended up going here instead! definitely deliscious food! their combination plates are the best! beef amiyake is my fave (sizzling ribye) and their salmon teriyake as well!! it's so yummie words can't even explain... portions are great... every person that i have taken here came back on their own bringing their own friend!!! the sushi is medioker! i come here for the bento box!!!
author: Renee S.

description: You get a good value here and the beef amiyaki is really good.  Service is really slow since Esther is usually the only one there.  Sushi is fresh but portions are small but they are cheap.  One thing, double check you bill when you get it.  They usually overcharge, but I don't think they do it on purpose; it's just those mistakes...
author: A N.

description: are u kiddin?? this is prolly the best jap restaurant...! affordable and cozy! the service sometimes sucks, but is worth it; the waitresses are sweet! n they give u free soup! woo hoo u gotta try their spicy tuna and dynamite roll!  you gotta try this!
author: angela l.

description: The food wasn't really good and somewhat expensive.  The service was terrible.  I went here only once and I'm sure I'll never go there again.  Now I go to the Wasabi Sushi Restaurant that is across from it.  I think Wasabi's food is better and the design there is way nicer.
author: Jennifer L.

description: THE BEST JAPANESE RESTAURANT in SF! I love how friendly the staff is! They know you by name and your order each time. The best service. Fast and the food is great!
author: lee d.
